biography.content: Steven Tötösy de Zepetnek's fields of scholarship include comparative cultural studies; comparative literature; comparative media and communication studies; postcolonial studies; (im)migration and ethnic minority studies; digital humanities; data science; education studies; online teaching and course design; editing and publishing print & online; film and literature; audience studies; European, US-American, and Canadian cultures and literatures; history; bibliography; conflict management and diversity training. Education: Ph.D. Comparative Literature University of Alberta 1989, B.Ed. History and English as a Second Language University of Ottawa 1984, M.A. Comparative Literature Carleton University 1983, B.A. History and German Studies The University of Western Ontario 1980. Languages: near-native English, native German & Hungarian, fluent French, reading Latin, Italian, Spanish, Russian. Teaching and academic service: Purdue University 2000-, University of Halle-Wittenberg 2002-2011, National Sun Yat-sen University 2008-2010, University of Alberta 1984-2000 & (distinguished) visiting professorships in the U.S., Europe, and Asia. Publications: single-authored books include Comparative Humanities and the Relevance of Liberal Arts (forthcoming); Comparative Literature: Theory, Meth-od, Application; The Social Dimensions of Fiction & edited volumes include Digital Humanities and the Study of Intermediality in Comparative Cultural Studies; Companion to Comparative Literature, World Literatures, and Comparative Cultural Studies; Mapping the World, Culture, and Border-crossing; Perspectives on Identity, Migra-tion, and Displacement; Imre Kertész and Holocaust Literature; Comparative Hungarian Cultural Studies; Com-parative Central European Holocaust Studies; The New Central and East European Culture; Comparative Cultural Studies and Michael Ondaatje's Writing; 200+ articles in peer-reviewed journals incl. publications in Chinese, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Macedonian, Marathi, Polish, Portuguese, Spanish translation; edit-ing & publishing: 1999- CLCWeb: Comparative Literature and Culture, 2001- Purdue print monograph series of Books in Comparative Cultural Studies, 1989-2000 University of Alberta print monograph series of Books in Comparative Literature, 1989-1997 Canadian Review of Comparative Literature / Revue Canadienne de Littéra-ture Comparée, special & thematic issues in learned journals. Tötösy de Zepetnek is member of several national and international humanities and social sciences learned associations and elected member of the European Acad-emy of Sciences and Arts / Academia Scientiarum et Artium Europea http://www.euro-acad.eu
